fields.description: Next Capability Offset: Indicates offset to the next PCI Express capability structure. The default next pointer value is dynamic and is dependent on whether the strap or LMI bits are set.
fields.name: NCO

fields.description: Capability Version: Specifies the SIG assigned value for the version of the capability structure. This field is set by default to 1, but can be modified from the local management bus.
fields.name: CV

fields.description: PCI Express Extended Capability ID: This field is hardwired to the Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to the Resizable BAR Capability (0015 hex).
fields.name: PECID

fields.description: Class Code: Identifies the function of the device. On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be rewritten independently for each Function from the local management bus
fields.name: CC

fields.description: Sub-Class Code: Identifies a sub-category within the selected function. On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: SCC

fields.description: Programming Interface Byte: Identifies the register set layout of the device. On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: PIB

fields.description: Revision ID: Assigned by the manufacturer of the device to identify the revision number of the device. On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: RID

fields.description: Subsystem ID: Specifies the Subsystem ID assigned by the manufacturer of the device. On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: SID

fields.description: Subsystem Vendor ID: Specifies the Subsystem Vendor ID assigned by the PCI SIG to the manufacturer of the device.On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be rewritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: SVID

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: Page Sizes: Page sizes supported by the device (one bit for each page size). The Controller implements only bits 15:0 of this register. The default value of this field is specified in reg_defaults.h, but can be re-written independently for each PF from the local management bus.
fields.name: PS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: System Page Size: This field must be programmed by software to the current page size in use. TheController implements only bits 15:0 of this register. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: SPS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R7

fields.description: Uncorrectable Internal Error Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of internal errors. STICKY.
fields.name: UIEM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R6

fields.description: Unsupported Request Error Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of unexpected requests received from the link. STICKY.
fields.name: UREM

fields.description: ECRC Error Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of ECRC errors. STICKY.
fields.name: EEM

fields.description: Malformed TLP Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of malformed TLPs received from the link. STICKY.
fields.name: MTM

fields.description: Receiver Overflow Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of violations of receive credit. STICKY.
fields.name: ROM

fields.description: Unexpected Completion Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of unexpected Completions received by the Controller. STICKY.
fields.name: UCM

fields.description: Completer Abort Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of the Controller sending a Completer Abort. STICKY.
fields.name: CAM

fields.description: Completion Timeout Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of Completion Timeouts. STICKY.
fields.name: CTM

fields.description: Flow Control Protocol Error Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of Flow Control Protocol Errors. STICKY.
fields.name: FCPEM

fields.description: Poisoned TLP Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of a Poisoned TLP. STICKY.
fields.name: PTM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R5

fields.description: Data Link Protocol Error Mask: This bit is set to mask the reporting of Data Link Protocol Errors. STICKY.
fields.name: DLPEM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R4

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R12

fields.description: Uncorrectable Internal Error Severity: Severity of internal errors (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: UIES

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R11

fields.description: Unsupported Requeset Error Severity: Severity of unexpected requests received from the link (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: URES

fields.description: ECRC Error Severity: Severity of ECRC errors (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: EES

fields.description: Malformed TLP Severity: Severity of malformed TLPs received from the link (0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: MTS

fields.description: Receiver Overflow Severity: Severity of receive credit violations (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: ROS

fields.description: Unexpected Completion Severity: Severity of unexpected Completions received by the Controller (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: UCS

fields.description: Completer Abort Severity: Severity of sending a Completer Abort (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: CAS

fields.description: Completion Timeout Severity: Severity of Completion Timeouts (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: CTS

fields.description: Flow Control Protocol Error Severity: Severity of Flow Control Protocol Errors (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: FCPES

fields.description: Poisoned TLP Severity: Severity of a Poisoned TLP error (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: PTS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R10

fields.description: Surprise Down Error Severity: hard coded to 1
fields.name: SDES

fields.description: Data Link Protocol Error Severity: Severity of Data Link Protocol Errors (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.
fields.name: DLPER

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R8

fields.description: Reserved:
fields.name: R3

fields.description: Uncorrectable Internal Error Status: This bit is set when the Controller has detected an internal uncorrectable error (HAL parity error or an uncorrectable ECC error while reading from any of the RAMs). This bit is also set in response to the client signaling an internal error through the input UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_IN. This error is not Function-specific. This error is considered fatal by default, and is reported by sending an ERR_FATAL message. STICKY.
fields.name: UIE

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R2

fields.description: Unsupported Request Error Status: This bit is set when the Controller has received a request from the link that it does not support. This error is not Function-specific. This error is considered non-fatal by default. In the special case described in Sections 6.2.3.2.4.1 of the PCI Express Specifications, the error is reported by sending an ERR_COR message. In all other cases, the error is reported by sending an ERR_NONFATAL message. The header of the received request that caused the error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: URES

fields.description: ECRC Error Status: This bit is set when the Controller has detected an ECRC error in a received TLP. This error is not Function-specific. The header of the received TLP with error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: EES

fields.description: Malformed TLP Status: This bit is set when the Controller receives a malformed TLP from the link. This error is not Function-specific. This error is considered fatal by default, and is reported by sending an ERR_FATAL message. The header of the received TLP with error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: MTS

fields.description: Receiver Overflow Status: This bit is set when the Controller receives a TLP in violation of the receive credit currently available. This error is not Function-specific. STICKY.
fields.name: ROS

fields.description: Unexpected Completion Status: This bit is set when the Controller has received an unexpected Completion packet from the link. This error is not Function-specific. STICKY.
fields.name: UCS

fields.description: Completer Abort Status: This bit is set when the Controller has returned the Completer Abort (CA) status to a request received from the link. This error is Function-specific. The header of the received request that caused the error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: CAS

fields.description: Completion Timeout Status: This bit is set when the completion timer associated with an outstanding request times out. This error is Function-specific. This error is considered non-fatal by default. STICKY.
fields.name: CTS

fields.description: Flow Control Protocol Error Status: This bit is set when certain violations of the flow control protocol are detected by the Controller. See Section 2.6.1 for details. This error is not Function-specific STICKY.
fields.name: FCPES

fields.description: Poisoned TLP Status: This bit is set when the Controller receives a poisoned TLP from the link. This error is Function-specific. This error is considered non-fatal by default. The error is reported by sending an ERR_NONFATAL message. The header of the received TLP with error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: PTS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R1

fields.description: Data Link Protocol Error Status: This bit is set when the Controller receives an Ack or Nak DLLP whose sequence number does not correspond to that of an unacknowledged TLP or that of the last acknowledged TLP (for details, refer to PCI Express Base Specification 1.1, Section 3.5.2). This error is not Function-specific, and is reported by Function 0. STICKY.
fields.name: DLPES

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: Device ID: Device ID assigned by the manufacturer of the device. On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be rewritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: DID

fields.description: Vendor ID: This is the Vendor ID assigned by PCI SIG to the manufacturer of the device.On power-up, the Controller sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be rewritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: VID

fields.description: VSEC Control Out: The state of these bits drive the output pins Fx_VSEC_CONTROL_OUT ( where x is the function number). These are implemented as register bits that can be read and written by the host through a Config transaction, or via the local management interface.
fields.name: VSEC_COUT

fields.description: Host-Triggered Interrupt: The state of this bit drives the output pins Fx_VSEC_INTERRUPT_OUT ( where x is the function number). It can be used by the host to signal a software-driven interrupt to the application logic outside the Controller. This bit may be read and written by the host through a Config transaction, or via the local management interface.
fields.name: HTI

fields.description: VSEC Control In: The 8-bit value read from this field of PFx reflects the setting of Fx_VSEC_CONTROL_IN[7:0] input to the Controller. This field can also be read from the local management bus
fields.name: VSEC_CIN

fields.description: General-Purpose Data: These bits are implemented as register bits that can be read and written by the host through a Config transaction, or via the local management interface. Their use is application-dependent.
fields.name: GPD

fields.description: VSEC Length: Total byte count (in hex format) of the VSEC structure, including the Vendor-Specific Capability Header, the Vendor-Specific Header and the Vendor-Specific registers. This field can be written from the local management bus independently or each PF.
fields.name: VL

fields.description: VSEC Revision: Vendor-defined version number for the VSEC structure. This field can be written from the local management bus independently or each PF.
fields.name: VR

fields.description: VSEC ID: This field contains a vendor defined ID number that indicates the nature and format of the information in the Vendor-Specific Capability Structure. This field can be written from the local management bus independently or each PF.
fields.name: VI

fields.description: Next Capability Offset: Indicates offset to the next PCI Express capability structure. The default next pointer value is dynamic and is dependent on whether the strap or LMI bits are set.
fields.name: NCO

fields.description: Capability Version: Specifies the SIG assigned value for the version of the capability structure. This field is set by default to 1, but can be modified independently for each PF from the local management bus.
fields.name: CV

fields.description: PCI Express Extended Capability ID: This field is hardwired to the Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to the Vendor-Specific Extended Capability.
fields.name: PECI
